SEARCH
Package app.network

Class Server

java.lang.Object
app.network.Server
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class Server extends Object implements Runnable
This class contains the implementation of a Game server. The logic here is similar to offline game in App, but with a different set of functions that utilises java.net

  • Constructor Details

    • Server

      public Server(ServerSocket serverSocket, int[] playerCount)
      Constructor for the game server
      Parameters:
      serverSocket - The server's socket so that it is able to listen for other clients.
      playerCount - An int array that contains the number of human and bot players.

  • Method Details

    • startServer

      public boolean startServer()
      This method is used to connect the clients to the game server and set up the game. It will listen for clients who are joining, validate their username, and then connect them.
      Returns:
      true when there are enough players to start the game

    • executeTurn

      public void executeTurn()
      Helper function to run one turn in the game

    • executeLastTurn

      public void executeLastTurn()
      Helper function to run the last turns in the game. Similar to executeTurn, but will inform each player why the game is on its last round.

    • executeDiscards

      public void executeDiscards()
      Helper function to help ask each player to discard their cards.

    • showFinalGameResults

      public void showFinalGameResults()
      Helper function to display the final game results.

    • closeServerSocket

      public void closeServerSocket()
      To shutdown the server.

    • showIpAddress

      public void showIpAddress() throws SocketException
      A method to display the possible IP addresses that clients can use to connect to the host
      Throws:
      SocketException - if there is no configured interface, this error is thrown

    • run

      public void run()
      To override the abstract method in Runnable. Similar to a main method, this is used to run the game server on a different thread, so that we can still allow the user to use the terminal as the server will need to continuously listen and send messages to and fro the clients.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
